intro: Wormskioldia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are annual or biennial herbs. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. They produce bright yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Wormskioldia species are often found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
